p: Since intermolecular hydrogen bonds between protein–drug complexes have a significant contribution to the conformational stability of the complex, the total number of hydrogen bonds is calculated ( Figure 4(e)). The average number of hydrogen bonds observed in apo–Mpro is 510.2 ± 11.80. The Bromocriptine–Mpro complex has the most hydrogen bonds over the 100 ns simulation time ( Table 3).
